Description: Mould-made circular oil lamp (very worn). Elongated protruding slightly fan-shaped nozzle with a hole in the end, flanked by crude volutes. Central hole surrounded by a raised circle, then small circles. Small circular raised base. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. No slip.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Late 2nd to 1st century BC parallels from Tell Atrib (Młynarczyk 2012, type TA 11.7), variants of such lamps continued into the 2nd century AD, possibly later (Mlynarczyk 1997, 83, Type M and M-Prime). Mlynarczyk, J. 1997. Alexandrian and Alexandria-influenced mould-made lamps of the Hellenistic period. BAR International Series 677. Młynarczyk, J. 2012. Tell Atrib 1985-1995. Vol. 3: Terracotta oil lamps. Varsovie : Éditions Neriton.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (KE.44) (Phase 3)
